item.title:
Milei, all the governments of Argentina during the last few decades in the left and the right had a pact with banks to screw common people.
Please pass legislation that can help crypto companies compete with banks. With stablecoins and non custodial services we can quickly become a north star of the power that crypto can give back to the common citicizen.
Iâ€™m not gonna criticize the memecoin. At this point Iâ€™m only asking for regulators and politicians to let us show the power of tech and freedom so that we can easily outcompete old school solutions that steal from everyone.
I implore you, please help real builders solve real problems of our country.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
Milei, all the governments of Argentina during the last few decades in the left and the right had a pact with banks to screw common people.

Please pass legislation that can help crypto companies compete with banks. With stablecoins and non custodial services we can quickly become a north star of the power that crypto can give back to the common citicizen.

Iâ€™m not gonna criticize the memecoin. At this point Iâ€™m only asking for regulators and politicians to let us show the power of tech and freedom so that we can easily outcompete old school solutions that steal from everyone.

I implore you, please help real builders solve real problems of our country.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Ethereum's largest network upgrade in history, Pectra, will be going live soon - key dates:
- Holesky testnet fork - February 24th
- Sepolia testnet fork - March 5th
- Ethereum mainnet fork - early April
item.dc:creator: @sassal0x
item.description:
Ethereum's largest network upgrade in history, Pectra, will be going live soon - key dates:

- Holesky testnet fork - February 24th

- Sepolia testnet fork - March 5th

- Ethereum mainnet fork - early April

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: 5/ How we solve scaling: â†’ Follower nodes opt in to receive Frag updates (batches of preconfirmed txs) from the gateway throughout the block â†’ The op-node then feeds these Frags to the Execution Layer through an extended Engine API â†’ This allows early transaction execution, which in turn enables preconfirmed state to be served via the standard Eth JSON RPC, well before final block sealing.
Nodes that donâ€™t opt-in simply follow the chain as usual.
item.dc:creator: @gattacahq
item.description:
5/ How we solve scaling:
â†’ Follower nodes opt in to receive Frag updates (batches of preconfirmed txs) from the gateway throughout the block
â†’ The op-node then feeds these Frags to the Execution Layer through an extended Engine API
â†’ This allows early transaction execution, which in turn enables preconfirmed state to be served via the standard Eth JSON RPC, well before final block sealing.

Nodes that donâ€™t opt-in simply follow the chain as usual.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: 4/ We have introduced two new key components: 1ï¸âƒ£ The Gateway, a new high-performance sequencer providing fast execution preconfs on behalf of L1 proposers.
2ï¸âƒ£ The Portal, a sequencer sidecar that enables external block production. This is inspired by Rollup Boostâ€™s original design, with added support for multiple gateways.
item.dc:creator: @gattacahq
item.description:
4/ We have introduced two new key components:
1ï¸âƒ£ The Gateway, a new high-performance sequencer providing fast execution preconfs on behalf of L1 proposers.

2ï¸âƒ£ The Portal, a sequencer sidecar that enables external block production. This is inspired by Rollup Boostâ€™s original design, with added support for multiple gateways.
